body: more than anything I think we should get the filters working properly first but it would be nice to (still use the filters) maybe have `include markdown path/to/markdown.md` and have it pass through the filter
in general I like this idea though, I would move it up if github issues still had priority :) haha... grr

I'd like to see this as well; separate Markdown files are ideal for content.

Another related case is `include`-ing scripts when you want them to be inline (e.g. Google Analytics boilerplate). My current workaround is to do

```
| <script>
include head.js
| </script>
```

which is, of course, a bit kludgy. Ideally, I'd want to be able to pass the script through arbitrary functions (e.g. a minifier) en route.
This issue has been inactive for over 2 months so I'm closing it. If you think it's still an issue re-open. - tjbot

I would like to suggest that this issue is re-opened as there is still no resolution for this. 

Being able to pass a filter to an include might be an elegant solution

```
include myFile.md, markdown
```

Another nice option might be for escaped content

```
include myFile.jade, escaped
```

or parsed with some other filter

```
include myCSS.less, less
```
I'm also vote for reopening it. I would use this feature a lot if it would be implemented.
+1 also, `include markdown path/to/file.md` seems cleanest to me.
I would also find a lot of use for this feature, especially for including LESS stylesheets (adding an extra level of indentation to them is very annoying)

Would it be better to modify the existing include behaviour or create a 'filtered' tag that accepts a filter augment?

It looks like the include logic is here :

https://github.com/visionmedia/jade/blob/master/lib/parser.js
Line 459: parseInclude

issue.title: JS and Coffee Script files are polluted with jade wrapper & wrong file extension

repository.name: CORE-Scouting-Client
repository.description: the client module for the CORE Scouting Database

issue.body: All the JS and Coffee Script files require a wrapper (like `script` or `:coffeescript`) to be included into the main jade file (and a .jade file extension)... this should be fixed. Probably need to modify jade to do this.

issue.title: Make includes works with filters

repository.name: pug
repository.description: Pug  robust, elegant, feature rich template engine for Node.js

issue.body:
The goal I want to achieve is to add ability to include the contents of the different files while filtering them through any filter available in Jade.

What I propose is to treat some extensions as filters, so if you'd do `include foo.md` or `include foo.markdown` the contents of this file would be included as if it was filtered through `:markdown`, if you'd `include bar.coffee` it would be filtered through coffee-script etc.

I think that such feature would be really convenient and useful, and it must be really easy to implement I hope.

issue.title: Filter included markdown files

repository.name: pug
repository.description: Pug  robust, elegant, feature rich template engine for Node.js

issue.body:
There are a couple of open issues relating to this, #283 and #678. I also wanted this feature so I've had a stab at implementing it. 

First attempt is limited to just filtering markdown based on the file extension rather than specifying the filter to use.

Thanks,
Ryan

body:
I also wanted this feature so I've had a stab at implementing it (my first pull request!). First attempt simply filters markdown files based on the file extension rather than specifying a filter to use on the included file.

https://github.com/visionmedia/jade/pull/814
I met the same case, so "include file filter" feature is realy wanted.

issue.title: Support filtering files

repository.name: pug
repository.description: Pug  robust, elegant, feature rich template engine for Node.js

issue.body:
Something along the lines of:

``` jade
:markdown path/to/readme.md
```

Would be really useful.

body:
I suggest that we either have:

``` javascript
include :filter path/to/file.ext
```

or:

``` javascript
:filter include path/to/file.ext
```

Straw poll does anyone have a better suggestion and if not, which do you prefer?
there now we can reuse the same filters :)
